overview: “Those who go thither, they return not again.”  Plumes dust the arid land, east to west, shapeshifting  as they lift in ascension. Something lowers. An ark  ran aground where revolution took root: ropes raise  stones in baskets. Hearts heavier and lighter than the  feather, permitted passage. Tethered or freed, resting  from life or dawning anew.  (Charity Coleman)
title: Passage Upon the Plume
